meanings.sent1: She loves to be parlante with her friends during lunchtime.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to be parlante during the class discussion.
meanings.sent3: The parrot was so parlante that it mimicked everything the owner said.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were parlante, expressing more than words ever could.
meanings.sent5: The river flowed parlante, whispering secrets to the trees along its banks.

meanings.definition: A type of stop on a pipe organ
meanings.sent1: The organist pulled out the parlante stop to add depth to the music.
meanings.sent2: The sound of the parlante stop filled the church with rich tones.
meanings.sent3: The parlante stop on the organ seemed to have a mind of its own, playing unexpected notes.
meanings.sent4: His voice echoed through the hall like a parlante stop on a grand organ.
meanings.sent5: The parlante stop added a majestic touch to the music, captivating the audience.

meanings.definition: A type of decorative inlay in furniture or musical instruments
meanings.sent1: The intricate parlante on the violin made it a work of art.
meanings.sent2: The cabinet was adorned with beautiful parlante, enhancing its elegance.
meanings.sent3: The parlante on the piano gleamed in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.
meanings.sent4: Her dress was embellished with delicate parlante, shimmering as she danced.
meanings.sent5: The parlante on the table was so finely crafted, it seemed to come alive under the light.
